On this page, you will find a selection of my past coursework from geography and environmental studies classes, covering topics from GIS and environmental justice to fieldwork and data storytelling.

<div class="project-card">
  <a href="GEOG176C_Project.qmd">
    <img src="projectmedia/GEOG176C_poster.jpg" alt="Mapping Nitrate Contamination in Fresno County" width="100%" />
    <h3>GEOG 176C – Mapping Nitrate Contamination in Fresno County</h3>
  </a>
  <p>This final project for Geography 176C is a spatial analysis of nitrate contamination in Fresno County domestic wells. This project applies kriging, spatial joins, and hot spot analysis to examine environmental justice concerns in relation to cropland proximity.</p>
</div>

<div class="project-card">
  <a href="GEOG176B_Project.qmd">
    <h3>GEOG 176B – Transportation Planning for the Olympics</h3>
  </a>
  <p>This final project for my Geography 176B course focused on Los Angeles’ transportation system, and if it is capable to handle the incoming population flux for the 2028 Olympics.</p>
</div>
